channel.title: lc_bit on Siwei's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in lc_bit on Siwei's Blog

item.title: 476 Number Complement
item.description: Given a positive integer num, output its complement number. The complement strategy is to flip the bits of its binary representation. Example 1: Input: num = 5 Output: 2 Explanation: The binary representation of 5 is 101 (no leading zero bits), and its complement is 010. So you need to output 2. Example 2: Input: num = 1 Output: 0 Explanation: The binary representation of 1 is 1 (no leading zero bits), and its complement is 0.
